clinical_study.brief_title: Ischemic Conditioning by Aircrews for Refractory Occlusions
clinical_study.official_title: Ischemic Conditioning by Aircrews for Refractory Occlusions (ICARO)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the feasibility of performing remote limb ischemic conditioning (RLIC) using the Doctormate device, a special blood pressure device used to perform RLIC, on patients with acute ischemic stroke due to large vessel occlusion being transported to a thrombectomy capable center by the helicopter.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study, 15 subjects presenting to a community hospital with signs and symptoms of ischemic stroke due to large vessel occlusion, transported to a comprehensive stroke center by aircew will receive RLIC using the Doctormate device.
The RLIC treatment will consist of 3-5 cycles ( depending on transportation time) of 5 minutes inflations of both blood pressure cuffs simultaneously. Blood pressure will be 200 mm HG with 5 minutes of reperfusion between each inflation.
Subjects will be evaluated upon arrival to the comprehensive stroke center and evaluated for side effects.
The study will be conducted at one site ( University of Iowa Hospitals and Clinics)

primary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of the flight, typically 30 min-3 hours depending on weather and distance of the community hospital
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility of performing RLIC by aircrew. This will be measured using a questionnaire filled by the aircrew staff. The questionnaire will provide information about the duration of the treatment provided, and any adverse events.

arm_group.description: Doctormate device used en route to the comprehensive stroke center

intervention.description: RLIC will be done using a specialized blood pressure device ( Doctormate) that inflates to 200 mm HG for 5 minutes followed by 5 minutes deflation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥18 years and ≤ 80 years
2. Acute Stroke symptoms
3. Symptoms indicating large vessel occlusion (aphasia, agnosia, neglect, visual field cut, gaze preference)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any intracranial hemorrhage on CT scan at the community hospital
2. History of upper extremity ischemia, subclavian stenosis or steal syndrome, any upper extremity injury that might be a contraindication to having a blood pressure cuff on the arm for the ischemic conditioning treatment
3. Subjects with diabetes mellitus type II.
4. Enrollment in another clinical trial.
5. Pregnancy
